cons: Rainy days could prevent from enjoying the full experience

pros: The students are pretty amazing, especially when they are motivated.
cons: Adjuncts are not paid well. In fact, as an adjunct, you can apply for welfare and get it. The amount of classes you can teach are unstable, so properly budgeting is hard. And, no matter how long you work at this university, no one ever talks to you about raises or how to progress. It's a dead-end job.

pros: Coworkers are easy to get along with and work well as a team.
cons: Poor leadership and unrealistic expectations with no compensation for increased workload.

pros: Great people to work alongside; beautiful campus.
cons: Benefits and retirement plans aren’t the best.

pros: Reinhardt University is a genuinely enjoyable place to work. Friendly and personable faculty and staff, a beautiful campus, and a mostly relaxed atmosphere make for a work environment that makes employees want to hang around for as long as possible.
cons: In my personal experience, advancement and promotion was pretty much impossible due to a limited budget in my department. If you're applying for a part time position, check in advance for the possibility of promotion as soon as possible.

pros: It is a short commute for me.  Benefits are good.  Most staff members are great.  Especially grounds, maintenance and housekeeping.
cons: Upper management does not have the backbone to correct a problem presented to them.  They are uncomfortable with confrontation.  Loyalty and length of service does not matter.  They do not support an employee if you confront upper management with a problem.  They just smile at you and change the subject.  They speak well and say whatever they need to bring in the money but employees do not matter.  Unless your a teacher.  Regular staff are second class.  Do not be fooled if you want to work or attend a traditional 'Christian' college.  It is far from it.  Most of the staff I've worked with are excellent.  They are really like family.  But as typical of any workplace, the upper management lacks backbone.  They turn away from adversity. The college is ruining this once quite, small town.

pros: Reinhardt is a beautiful place to work. Given that it is a small university, it brings a small classroom feel to teaching. You have one on one and small group interaction with students, which allows you as a faculty member to watch them grow throughout their college career. They have a great student body and it can be a very rewarding place to work from a teaching prospective.
cons: There is very little direction and sometimes difficult to gain an understanding of policies. It seems that a lot of things are done just because they have "always been done that way."

job_title: Assistant Technical Director in Waleska, GA
pros: You get to work with some amazing faculty and staff who invest in your growth by letting you take the helm on projects. You are allowed large amounts if leadership and entrusted with much responsibility. You get to use your creative and technical brain and work multiple touring shows and student produced, along with main stage productions.
cons: Hard work. Not for someone looking to breeze by. Lots of hours for a feeble pay. Often have to fight through the Frey of being young compared to those you are working with.

review_title: Reinhardt is not what it seems on the surface.
pros: Small town, commute is great if coming from Atlanta, housekeeping staff is awesome, students are (for the most part) wonderful, world class cultural events
cons: The lack of interest or concern for the students by the majority of the faculty.  Blatant negative attitudes toward certain populations of students by said faculty.  Reinhardt prides itself on being there all the way for the students.  It couldn't be further from the truth.

review_title: Great company but no room for advancement or pay increases
pros: Depending on the position or department, the hours can be somewhat flexible
cons: There are usually no annual salary increases, and there is no room for growth.

pros: Very flexible employer for scheduling classes
cons: I did not experience any cons while working with this employer

pros: The organizational culture is friendly and everyone supports learning/education.
cons: A very relaxed environment.  Not much room to move into upper-level positions.
